Package rover

  • Class Summary
    Class Description
    ColorEye
    The EV3 lego brick can be connected to a color sensor, here called ColorEye (because it kind of looks like a single eye).
    Engine
    The EV3 lego brick can be connected to motors, here called Engine.
    Grabber
    A wrapper class to make the use of the pliers of the rover easier.
    Logger
    Output streams wrapper to help writing stuff in both the console and log files.
    Map
    Extended version of an abstract MapZone.
    MapZone
    Absolute frame: origin left down (starting zone side is down) corner of the map; X axis is defined along the length of the map Relative frame: origin is the initial position of the rover, center of the starting zone; X axis is defined by initial rover heading, along the length of the map (2.5m) All MapZones will be defined in relative frame.
    Navigator
    A navigator is the central control of the rover's movements.
    Peripheral
    An abstraction of any peripheral that could be connected to the EV3 lego brick.
    RecupZone
    Extended version of an abstract MapZone.
    Rover
    To carry out a mission, the most common way is to build and use a rover.
    RoverMode
    Interface to use any rover mode indifferently.
    Tester
    A simple executable class that wrapps a whole lot of possible tests on the rover.
    UltraEyes
    The EV3 lego brick can be connected to an ultrasonic sensor, here called UltraEyes (because it looks like a pair of eyes).
